Reviews.Title: “Pretty typical”
Reviews.Author: dickie70
Reviews.Content: Hyatt places are very consistant and this one is no exception. Good airport shuttle service and free shuttle service to the strip. I did however have trouble getting picked up on time from the strip to the hotel. Free cold breakfast, hot food for purchase. Staff friendly. Right across the street from the Hard Rock hotel/casino. About 25 minute brisk walk to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Groups”
Reviews.Author: Jessica V
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 60 athletes can be a challenge, but the Hyatt Place in Las Vegas was the BEST service we have encountered from hotel staff ever. Check in was quick and easy, free wifi, and they were very accommodating to our group's needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Sales Manager”
Reviews.Author: monique b
Reviews.Content: I can't thank Dawn WoodCock enough for her excellent service as Manager of Sales. For her to be able to accommadate our SW Airlines employees the day before our arrival. The minute I got off the phone she sent me all the information and had everything done within an hour. It was great to have free shuttle pick up and drop off to the airport where we were working and not having to worry about paying for a cab and leaving exactly on the minute they said! Being able to walk to the strip and a short cab ride back for $11.00 made this location perfect and not having to spend a lot of money for a excellent room. Wish I could have stayed longer. We will continue to use this hotel in the future and use Hyatt Place in other locations as well. The Hotel was super clean and provided great amentities for the price and free breakfast! The front desk employee and the two young gentleman that picked us up and dropped us off to the aiport on Jan. 24th and 25th provided great service! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “As advertised”
Reviews.Author: marktravelnow
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice hotel, friendly helpful staff. Average breakfast. Off the strip hotel. Shuttle service to and from the Airport. Shuttle service to the strip dropping at Planet Hollywood. Planes fly over once in awhile as the Hotel is located at the end of the runway. Great alternative if you want a quite place to stay close but away from the bussel of the strip. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just to comment on some other review I saw here.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Bill707
Reviews.Content: First of all, I came here after 3 days at the Cosmopolitan. A huge step down I think we can all agree. Cosmo gives you a trip to the best buffet in Vegas for breakfast, Hyatt gives you cold cereal fruit and not very good coffee. Cosmo has wifi that works, Hyatt does not. Very slow if at all. The staff was fine, but management needs to get in the habit of walking the property and finding and fixing problems. Outside I saw a drip sprinkler do an excellent job of watering the parking lot. Lots of those little things to be corrected. In the bathtub, the spigot could not make up its mind to be show or tub fill and noisily let me know! And the design makes the room seem cramped. Windows were dirty also. I remember back in the 80's when the Hyatt name represented the best of hotel in this country. Sadly, that no longer seems the case. As far as other reviews, somebody mentioned requesting a strip view, that's not possible for a place being between Swenson and Paradise. You can see the tops of strip hotels I suppose, but I would not call that a strip view. Also, no taxis? Just about every cab going to or from the airport uses Paradise and Swenson. If you can't get an empty one to find you here, well, I have no response. Did you ask the front desk for help? In a worst case, just walk over to Hard Rock, they always have cabs, and the liquor store across the street ALWAYS has limo drivers around because it gives away free coffee, and they will take you anywhere, believe me. In sum, if it's a business trip, it's ok. If you are coming for the "vegas experience" no way. VERY convenient for the ride back to the airport however, about as close as you can get and I did enjoy watching the planes land from my room! Fear not the noise of that too, because they stop around ten.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, no taxis to be found”
Reviews.Author: Medas2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Place for the massive CES show. I have stayed at Hyatt Places in over a dozen city and they all deliver pretty much exactly the same product. Nice room, big TV, and a nice place to work. I also had a room with a great view of the strip in the distance. Very nice--ask for a strip view if you like. The free breakfast is OK, but is pretty limited. The hotel is very convenient to the airport and it is only about a 5 minute drive away. My only problem was that taxis were just about impossible to get. I would make arrangement ahead of time and none would show up. The CES show is high demand, but the hotel should have some plan in place for customers who might need to get somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Qwik trip”
Reviews.Author: timlankins
Reviews.Content: Made a quick trip down to meet up with friends visiting from the UK. Nice experience and nice facility

Reviews.Title: “REALLY NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: laucel
Reviews.Content: From the check in to the end of our trip, Hyatt Place Las Vegas was an outstanding experience. The hotel shuttle picked us up from Mc Carran airport and took us to the hotel as soon as we called them. The ckeck in was very quicly and the room was so spacious and clean that made our stay really comfortable. We are a family of two adults and three children and fitted perfectly well in a suite of two doubles and a sofa-bed. The shuttle was so useful taking us to and from the Strip (short distance) every hour. It drops you at Planet Hollywood hotel: excellent location! Across the street is a huge pharmacy open 24 hours, where you can buy food, medicine, etc, etc., and some restaurants. Breakfast was served daily: fruit, a variety of juices, milk, bagels, toast, which was really fresh and good. Staff extremely attentive!!! I would definitely go back because it was a really nice place to stay feeling cozy without the noise and crowds of the casinos in the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not convenient.”
Reviews.Author: mputman007
Reviews.Content: This property is right next to UNLV and a few blocks away from the "Strip". They run an hourly shuttle servie to the Planet Hollywood, but you're better off taking a cab if you don't mind paying about 8-10 bucks to actually get where you want to go. The rooms are clean and in great shape with new HDTVs and furniture. The grill food is adequate for quick in hotel dining, but drink chioces are limited and the front desk is woefully understaffed at check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Smoking, good service, convenient for business”
Reviews.Author: sd_in_switzerland
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to stay here for business and was very happy with the customer service. The front desk staff went out of their way to be helpful to me and very warm. They gave me wonderful tips (and maps) about how I could get to an urgent care center and personally ran things up to my room when I had forgotten them at the front desk. It was also conveniently located for business and blessedly non-smoking. Free wifi and free breakfast was also available. The rooms were also quite spacious with massive couches. On the downsides (and some of these may only only apply to business travelers), there was a bit of noise and light that made sleeping challenging next to the Hofbrau Haus, there were plenty of non-business types who came in at various stages of enibriation, and there was a small goof with my original room. Specifically, the room was not ready--the mattress was off the bed and the linens of what looked like the floor of the hotel were coming out of the bathroom. I was slightly shocked as I had never experienced anything like that before in any hotel. But when I went to notify them of it, they sorted the situation out immediately. I would estimate that this is one of the better non-smoking, non-gaming hotels in Vegas. But having not stayed at others, I cannot be certain. But I was pleased with this hotel in the end.

Reviews.Title: “across from the hard rock”
Reviews.Author: utt959
Reviews.Content: The rooms here have an interesting split design with a living area and the bed area separated and the tv on a swivel so you can see it from both spots. The hotel seemed new when I was there and very quiet. Across the street all the action is at the hard rock. So If you want a clean and quiet spot this could be a good option. Rate was a bit higher than a casino hotel but the cheaper rate are likely made up with your losses downstairs. No stationary available.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet away from Strip”
Reviews.Author: jjones4180
Reviews.Content: the hotel overall is nice. The rooms are pretty good however the furniture (sofa) in my room had stans from guest spilling liquids. The furniture could stand to be cleaned. The closet sliding door did not open all the way it kept falling of the track. The continental breakfast for free was not bad. I was able to get free hot to order breakfast using a room rate form an auto club. No resort fee and free parking. Hard Rock Casino is across teh street and teh Terribles casino about 2-3 blocks down the street. The Hofbräuhaus restaurant is right next door sharing the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place rocks”
Reviews.Author: MoreFFmiles
Reviews.Content: This particular hotel is in a great location, has a free airport shuttle *and* service to The Strip. You've got good options for dining and gaming steps away. Free parking. Very pleasant staff. Nice continental breakfast. Consistent. No complaints. I really think Hyatt has the very best product in the mid-scale space when it comes to Hyatt Place. I've stayed in quite a number of Hyatt Place properties now (and I darn well ought to have the Platinum status now - I think I've finally attained it). Many of the Hyatt Place properties are thoroughly / extensively renovated AmeriSuites and they have been done very well. I think the new build Hyatt Place properties are even better but I would still choose any Hyatt Place over a comparable choice. At the end of the day, the mid-scale hotel space is very crowded with all the comparable Marriott (Fairfield, Courtyard, TownePlace, SpringHill, etc.), Hilton Family (Hampton, HGI, Doubletree, Homewood, etc.), InterContinental Hotels Group (Holiday Inn Express) and more options. I've always thought of Hyatt as being a solid choice in upscale and high-end space but I was a bit skeptical about how far they'd be able to go with Hyatt Place. Hyatt and Marriott have the most lucrative promotions when it comes to their loyalty programs and this really drives my desire to stick with them whenever possible. I've come to very much like Hyatt Place - very much! I wish Hyatt had an app for my Blackberry (Marriott does)

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: SEQldMalleeboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed just the one night, but was impressed by the location, away from the maddening crowds, yet close enough to walk to it all if you wanted to. Front Desk service was relaxed, good natured and efficient. Room was excellent, quiet, well appointed, well equipped and clean. Breakfast pretty much your standard affair and adequate to get the day going. Should we ever return to Las Vegas we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: AGentlRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt Place on the Veterans Day weekend. We weren't in Las Vegas to gamble, but to visit friends, so this hotel was ideal. Check in was a pleasure, and although it was just after 11AM, we were given a room that was ready, which was great since we had arrived on a 5 hour flight from Florida. The rooms at this Hyatt were arranged the same as the Hyatt we stayed at the Orlando airport, very well appointed and everything in working order. I didn't realize when I booked with my AAA, that we were also given 2 free cooked to order breakfasts in addition to the complimentary breakfast buffet. My husband had a great looking waffle both mornings and he enjoyed it, plus there was fruit, bagels, muffins and other offerings as well as Starbucks coffee. I thought we would run into parking problems due to the restaurant next door, but I always found a space when we would return to the hotel. Unlike the Strip hotels, many of which charge a minimum of $10 for internet, wireless high speed internet was free here. A couple of times we would hear the planes taking off or landing, but you have to expect this from an airport hotel and this wouldn't affect the fact that I would rather stay here on my Las Vegas trips than the smoke-filled casino mega resorts, we were really treated like valued guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne05_11
Reviews.Content: If you want a quiet, clean hotel off the strip, but not far from the strip, then this is the place for you. Large clean rooms with sitting and desk area, TV that can be viewed from bed or sitting area, breakfast with delicious fresh fruit, courteous staff who are more than helpful and who address you by name, reasonable rates, make this hotel a great value. Walk next door for dinner at German restaurant. I would be sure to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: SportsTravler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were typical Hyatt place rooms, nice but nothing special. The location was okay this place is a few Vegas-blocks east from the strip. It was nice getting in and not having to go thru the smoky, noisy casino area before getting to your elevators to go to your room. It was nice that the hotel offered things like free breakfast and shuttle. But breakfast was disappointing and many people in our group had to wait a long time for the shuttle to arrive. Overall it's clean and provides decent accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fair stay at HP”
Reviews.Author: Mondo5280
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Hyatt Place and wasn't impressed. The room was nice, nothing special. Big 42" TV in the middle of the room so you could tilt it towards the bed or the sofa couches in the living room area. This room had a small fridge but that was it. Breakfast was so disappointing. All the good stuff had to be ordered and cost was around $7.99. Their free stuff was fruit, yogurt, cereal and breads (toast, bagel, mini-muffins). The price was above average from what you can get on the strip, but that's the big difference. This Place is a few Vegas-blocks east from the strip. It was nice getting in and not having to go thru the smoky, noisy casino area before getting to your elevators to go to your room. Getting here was a drag as you are dealing with one-way roads at your entrance/exits. Getting out of here to go up to the Sands expo area was a bit rough. As you exit, you have three turning lanes to pick from. During rush times, forget getting past the first lane. The second and third turning lanes are used to turn north-bound onto Paradise road, but if you can't get to lane 2 or 3, the 1st lane will go west on Harmon and take you to Koval Ln which you can then turn right and head north to the Sands Expo center.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful..”
Reviews.Author: TaniaTP16
Reviews.Content: As a former employee of Hyatt I had high expectations when I booked my room here and know what is expected of the staff. From the moment we landed this hotel disappointed me. It started off when we called to have the airport shuttle pick us up and were told no it's too late. The shuttle runs to the airport until midnight, it was 11:50 (yes, it was close, but good customer service means you go get your guests). The next 4 days was filled with nothing but rudeness from a majority of the staff. I'm disappointed because I used to work as a gallery host (title of front desk agents at hyatt place) so I know what's expected and how I treat people, and it wasn't right. The rooms were typical Hyatt place rooms, and the location was good, but the actions of the staff really affected how we felt on this trip. I even emailed the manager when I returned home and never heard back, I think that goes to show the lack of respect they have for guests. Overall, it's in no way a "bad" hotel, it's clean and provides decent accomodations, but I expect to be treated well when I am staying somewhere and this doesn't happen at Hyatt Place las vegas,

Reviews.Title: “For two or for a family”
Reviews.Author: Travelershep
Reviews.Content: Every year around October we go to Las Vegas to me my other halfs aunt (92) this year. Well I will stay at the Hyatt Place again. It is clean oriented for all types family stuff and also parents whose kids have gone. We arrived late and where asking where we could find a restaurant close by. They at the hotel have a 24 hour kitchen. The food was great and we where catered to the hilt on this. No one arm bandits in this hotel. I will go back their again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: duranimal70
Reviews.Content: Very nice and friendly staff. Spacious rooms with a pullout sofa. Good location across from the Hard Rock, and if you need anything there's a CVS right across the street. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay.”
Reviews.Author: ihumpdorks
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, nice spacious rooms, pull out couch, flat screen tv, continental breakfast and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great service for groups!”
Reviews.Author: carrwest
Reviews.Content: I took a group of about 20 through Las Vegas on the way to and from the Grand Canyon. The group sales agent provided excellent service and the rooms were great. I recommend this property for people on business or visiting to Vegas on pleasure (they have an airport shuttle and a shuttle that takes guests to the strip.)

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: sunset2261
Reviews.Content: Location is off the beaten path but not too far. Free Breakfast is nice- Pool is not much to speak of. It depends on what you are looking for...if you want to be out and about stay on the strip...otherwise it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and affordable non-casino hotel just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: 68monkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Place Las Vegas for a half-marathon race, rather than at the official race hotel (Hard Rock Hotel & Casino). If you are not a gambler (like me) then there's a lot to appreciate about staying in a 'normal' plain 'ol hotel like the Hyatt Place: large, clean rooms, wet bar and mini fridge, coffee maker, etc. It's located about .7 mile from the Strip and offers a decent night's sleep, without the noise, smoke-filled casinos, and general hootenanny that you find in many casino hotel properties. Granted, it doesn't have all the on-site access to gargantuan pool complexes, fine dining, etc... but you've got the Hofbrauhaus next door (excellent southern German food, by the way) which offers its own cheesy Vegas version of Teutonic entertainment and tipsy "Prost!"-ing, plus the Hard Rock complex is diagonally across the street and the Strip is only a little over a half mile away. And, for any of you who have ever had to suffer through the interminable taxi cab switchback wait on a Friday night getting in to Vegas... Hyatt Place offers a convenient, quick shuttle that literally had me at the hotel within 20 minutes of deplaning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and great room rates!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place Las Vegas provided great rates for our staff and made our time away from the office very comfortable and enjoyable. Would highly recommend Hyatt Place any time you are in Vegas whether it be for personal or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jaime C
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place Las Vegas & Staff are very professional, friendly, & timely. Our company uses the Hyatt Place for stays and meeting rooms very often. The meeting rooms are great and reasonably priced and we will continue to use them!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: ebum192
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly behind the Hofbrauhouse and is nearly across the street from the Hard Rock hotel. It is off the strip, but taxis are never far away. It was convenient and reasonably priced for a las vegas hotel. A few loud drunkards did stumble around and wake me up around 5am, but that was to be expected in Las Vegas, especially at a cheaper hotel like this. The breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place Staff Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: DarrenLaCroix
Reviews.Content: We just had a 3 day meeting at your hotel and your staff was amazing. We have people come from across the country and service to us and our people is important to our image. Your staff bent over backwards for us. Form the ladies at the front desk to Brent and Dawn, you made sure we had what we needed. Thanks! Two thumbs up. (I'd give a third if I had one!) Thanks, Darren LaCroix, World Champion of Public Speaking

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Close to the Rodeo”
Reviews.Author: zdzrbl
Reviews.Content: We go to the NFR in Las Vegas every year in December. Have stayed at the Hyatt Place for the past 5 years (use to be Amerisuites). Rooms are clean and have refrigerators. Plenty of parking. Complementary breakfast. Easy walk to the Thomas & Mack center for the rodeo. If you want to gamble, Hard Rock is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Will surely be back.”
Reviews.Author: LisaMeMe
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely. Quiet. Off the strip but close enough to get to. Great beds. Clean. Smallish outdoor pool but sufficient. Nice tables and sitting areas by the pool. All the staff was very kind and courteous. Free parking. On our next trip to Vegas we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Murphy60560
Reviews.Content: We used the Hotels Meeting space and were very impressed with the level of service we received. Would definitely use this space again in the future! THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Service Exceptional to none”
Reviews.Author: walleyeSouthbend
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, neat and tidy, organized room divided into comfortable areas for office work, resting. This was a business trip so was happy with the location in close proximity to the airport. Convenient shuttle service to and from the airport. I did not have need for it to the strip, No time this visit. Special thanks to AGM, Brett. He was very helpful in answering questions regarding location and distance to a meeting I had scheduled and even printed information for me. Very professional and helpful! I will return when I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “What I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: desertflowers
Reviews.Content: Friendly greeting from Sahara at check-in (that's her name!) gave me a great first impression. Since I had NO WAIT FOR CHECK-IN, I thought of other Las Vegas reviews that bemoaned long lines at flashier hotel/casinos. I needed a room with three beds, so this was great - two doubles and a convertible sofa. Since we were on our way to "KA" at the MGM Grand, this location was convenient. The room was large and comfortable, though the bathroom was awkward (toilet too close to the door!) and the plumbing had minor issues (bathtub slow to drain, sink made gurgling noise) which will hopefully be fixed. One elevator was out of order, but the other was fine. The hotel was sold out for the night we stayed, but the breakfast attendants worked hard to keep up with their refilling duties as the people kept streaming in. (Don't be late; breakfast is quickly cleared right on time.) The breads were fresh, the fresh fruit high quality, and the oatmeal cooked (not instant). Grateful for free parking, no resort fees, and location. Only heard one airplane, even though our 3rd-floor window faced the airport. All in all, an adequate-plus, safe, quiet place to stay just off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Business Meetings and Training”
Reviews.Author: kizwiz1
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of lodging at this Hyatt from June 19th-June 23rd. The reason for the trip was to pilot a leadership course for a group of military members. Considering I traveled from the east coast to manage this training offering I was very nervous about the facilities and service. Fortunately, the customer service was amazing! The meeting room was arranged to our specs, the technology worked flawlessly, and every evening they cleaned the meeting room and restocked our beverages without prompting. As a result, EVERYONE was able to focus on the training and the event was a hit! To top it all off, the director and assistant director of sales checked in on us regularly and even photocopied and overnighted important documents for us. Thank you Hyatt Place!

Reviews.Title: “For Being a HYATT I expected more and this Place is only good for business Overnights only... Breakfast is a JOKE!!!”
Reviews.Author: planedrs
Reviews.Content: Ok, where to start… the shuttle bus driver took off with out me even after I called the Hotel and told the front desk that it will take me at least 10 min. to make my way down to LEVEL 0. she replied to me that she has instructed the driver to wait for me; needless to say upon arriving to level 0 there was no shuttle bus driver… called front desk at they explained that he had to leave because there was another client who needed to check in – HMM… that is understandable and would’ve been fine with me if that was communicated to me when I first called; all this did was upset me because they told me that shuttle would be there. So I had to wait in the Vegas HEAT (95°+ deg.) for 20 min. I will say that the Driver was very nice and respectful and on the way to the hotel I calmed myself. No on to the Room#532 the Hotel is located off the strip which is good and bad depending on what you are there for. I was there for business so it was great for my needs, plus having the HARD ROCK CAFÉ across the street is there if you wish to mix in a little business with pleasure. Hard Rock Hotel is a younger wilder scene. My room at the Hyatt Place had Carpet Stains (see pic) by the coffee bar, room was also missing some of the toiletries (Tooth Paste), but overall I like the lay out of the room had a nice big 42” flat screen to view, also a fridge to store you choice of beverages and there are restaurants all within walking distance. So although the front desk service could’ve been better for having the HYATT name I was only pleased with staying there mainly because of the location of the Hotel. The So-called breakfast is a JOKE… Donuts and bagels is not a breakfast and I’ve seen LA Quinta serve better food and that is not saying much, HYATT could provide better amenities for the rate there asking. The Shuttle Bus runs 5a -12a -ish to the airport I STRONGLEY recommend that you get conformation on Shuttle hours prior to leaving anywhere to avoid being stranded and would ask the Shuttle driver versus asking the front desk because the couldn’t really give me a solid answer, this is why I put 5a – 12a ish because on the night I stayed there the drive told me that he will continue to operate until about 130a. If you’re traveling on business for an overnight I would recommend this place if you’re staying longer than that I stay elsewhere. Being a world business Traveler I began to take pictures of all place I have attendant in hope that it may help others.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill; great off main strip location”
Reviews.Author: ElaineG29
Reviews.Content: Not everyone is 25 and goes to Las Vegas to get drunk or see the sights (I'm not judging; just saying). I was there for a day at the Speedway and Las Vegas has the best options for quality reasonably priced accommodations. The staff was super friendly and the room was completely clean and everything we wanted. Didn't quite understand the line between the included breakfast and the made to order breakfast since I ordered one but didn't get charged. Definitely fit the bill and loved getting another stay credit (:))

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place Las Vegas perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicandBailey
Reviews.Content: My place of employment is nearby the Hyatt Place Las Vegas so I travel in regularly. This hotel is near the airport and within a short distance of everything you need. Dozens of great places to eat within four-five blocks. It is right across the street from the Hard Rock and the Hofbrau House is on the same block. It is also right across the street from UNLV. The front desk is very friendly and responsive to your needs. There is breakfast and a bar. The rooms are huge, small suites, comfortable beds, big-screen TV. While this place works if you're in Vegas for fun, I like it because it's not on the strip, but within a mile or two from what makes Las Vegas famous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for anyone traveling to Vegas for business”
Reviews.Author: GregMatt1920
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hyatt Place Las Vegas is top notch. I stay there usually 4 times a month for work, and the ease of check in is superb, the staff is very good at greeting you by name, and for the business traveler, the responsiveness to requests and the hotel shuttle ALWAYS being dependable is very important. The hotel is clean, the breakfast is well stocked and being so close to McCarran is a huge plus. The van drivers are friendly and dependable. I have stayed at this property over 50 times in the past two years and have never had an issue. Definitely recommended for the price. Plus, Sunday nights are the best with Dana and Kendra at the front desk!!! Greg Aragon

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of customer service- I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WillyAce65
Reviews.Content: I am a flight attendant for a major airline, and I stay in enough hotels to be able to recognize properties by carpet and curtains.I am based in Las Vegas but live elsewhere, and am responsible for my own housing when in base. Hyatt Place is my overwhelming choice! The staff truly understand customer service, and treat me the way I want to be treated. From the front desk who call me by name to the housekeeper who returned a family heirloom ring I lost to the van drivers who are always there with a smile, everything about this hotel is at the top of my list. If you are looking for a hotel that makes you feel right at home on a property that looks like a New York City boutique hotel (with much larger rooms!), then Hyatt Place is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice off strip hotel with multiple amenities”
Reviews.Author: SeaFamTrav
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived in Vegas as a stopover on the way to Zion NP. I chose the Hyatt Place because it had largely favorable reviews, was off strip, had an airport shuttle, and free breakfast. We paid ~100 with AAA. We got in around 11pm and the shuttle was prompt and courteous. Check in was simple and efficient. The room was quite large, with 2 queen beds in the sleeping area and a living area with a large sofa. This meant my kids could each sleep separately, which was great. Despite the location, near the airport, it was quiet and we slept undisturbed. In the morning, we enjoyed the limited offerings at the complimentary continental breakfast. Heartier fare was available for purchase, but we passed. The kids used the pool before we hit the road. All in all, this was a great hotel for our purposes - lots of amenities and close to the airport. Those looking for casino glitz and easy access to the strip will probably be disappointed, but for us it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sfayethomas
Reviews.Content: I recently held a two day Hiring Event at the Hyatt Place Las Vegas. My business contact - Dawn and the staff were extremely helpful. The event was a success in part due to the ease of scheduling and the friendly assistance from the Hyatt Place staff.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ToddWashington
Reviews.Content: Dawn and Erin took exceptional care to make sure the meeting that I had was top notch. I had consistent communication with them and the room was set above and beyond my expectations. The food that was served was fresh and full of flavor. I highly recommend anyone having a meeting in Las Vegas to check out the Hyatt Place accommodations before you book your meeting at one of the large unaccommodating hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Better Service Than Most 5 Star Resorts”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1958
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending 10 days at the Hyatt Place while attending a trade show. The show can be taxing and extremely tiring but with the service we recieved during our stay it made it feel like we where coming home each night. The entire staff went out of there way to accomadate "every" request. The service went far beyond what would be expected. This type of service was provided by every member of the staff. Do not hesitate to contact Dawn Woodcock to schedule your next meeting or family stay while in Las Vegas!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & nice hotel, but you can hear a planes every 3-5 minutes!”
Reviews.Author: Lorenita2005
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, if you have a rental car. It was very clean. Loved the hotel. The planes take off overhead about every 3-5 minutes. They stop around midnight and start back up around 5:30am. I'm not a light sleeper, and they woke me up every morning. We were walking to the car when a 747 passed over and you could feel the vibration from the plane throughout your whole body. It was kinda crazy! Because of this noise issue, I won't stay here again unless they have a good Hyatt points special promo. It's too bad, b/c everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, But A Little Expensive”
Reviews.Author: NevermindCA
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for the night, and didn't want to be on the Strip, so we chose the Hyatt Place and are glad we did. It is a bit pricey, but what isn't in Las Vegas? We were concerned it would be noisy because the property is right next to the airport, but we never heard jet traffic once we were inside. Hyatt Place Las Vegas has the typical Hyatt Place configuration of a sitting area with L-shaped sofa bed and large screen TV and separate sleeping area. We love this set up, since we don't have to sit on the bed to have conversation and relax. The free Internet, parking, and continental breakfast are also nice. The staff is very customer oriented and were polite and helpful. We had a problem with our air conditioning, which was address immediately. Our only complaint is that my husband had asked for a 7 a.m. wake-up call that never came. Fortunately we weren't catching a flight, so it didn't create a problem for us. We will definitely consider the Hyatt Place the next time we pass through Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: cpayce
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and beautiful, the staff were very friendly and accommodating. It was nice to have the continental breakfast every morning and the pool was great. The only thing that people should know is that the hotel is quite a distance from the strip. It is a long walk, however the hotel does have a shuttle to Planet Hollywood. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERIOR Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: LoKate
Reviews.Content: What great value, we were blown away by the attentive service of the staff, couldn't have been more helpful. Awesome complimentary breakfast, nice room with nice sitting area and big tv, fair hike to the strip but not too bad at all (we didnt want a casino and noise) walking distance to airport although they'll happily give you a lift when you need it. The staff were FANTASTIC, the manager was the friendliest one I"ve ever come across, great place, will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable room in quiet location, near airport but bit pricey so check for specials”
Reviews.Author: Mistyrose2k
Reviews.Content: Agree and disagree with previous reviews: Nice large comfortable room for solo and small family, my room was as pictured with the exception of the separating panal between bedroom and sitting area was Air Conditoner unit enclosed in a wall.( I stayed on 2nd floor) maybe that nakes a difference in the size room. If you need to be near the srip this might not do, but if you have a car it does not matter because there are a lot of free parking at the strip hotels( maybe time of year will make this a not a good option). BUT definately agree that price is a bit steep for a solo, or couple, because there are other strip hotels 3 stars plus that offer similar rates, just watch out for resort tax. The free internet access and continental breakfast was also a plus,and I guess the larger the group the better the savings. if you want eggs and fresh made breakfast, then a block away Terrible hotel and casino ( almost across the street) depending on which way you drive on the one way, you can have breakfast buffet or between 11 pm and 7am $2.99 eggs, ham, pancakes, ( it is not on the menu, but if you ask for it, because it is advertised throughout the Casino, your waiter can give you this price for this and other specials advertised but not in menu). Also in the what to do rack in the icemaker rooms, there are loads of coupons for free or 1/2 price buffet coupons for this and other hotels. The hotel was very clean, and peaceful place to stay. You can order lite meals, and pre made sandwiches in a pinch, but there are restaurants in vicinity, I had a car so did not use the shuttle, so cannot comment on that. I would definately stay here again if they lower the price, or have specials for weekly stay or repeat visitors. Overall: have large room, large TV, mini refig, Free internet access, you can attach games and other peripherals if you bring your own connection wires, and can connect portable dvd player bring your own wires, they have a panel in which to hook various peripherials into. continental breakfast, Cafe, can get limited made to order food and coffees, Microwave downstair is available all day.

Reviews.Title: “Big comfortable rooms good service”
Reviews.Author: mdwtravel
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great big rooms. We sttayed with our three teenage children in a room with two queen beds and a sofa bed. The room was divided in a bedroom and living room part with a great big tv. Very nice for a family of five with three teenagers. Also fridge and free wifi. The hotel also offers free shuttle service to the Strip, right to Planet Hollywood. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJ26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a mile off the strip but cost over $100 / night! They had a pool, but we couldn't enjoy it because it was so small that it was constantly full, the breakfast "buffet" consisted of the usual toast/ bagel bar, oatmeal, and cereal. That was it! If you wanted eggs, waffles, or anything of that nature you had to pay at least $7 extra! For my money the Holiday Inn Express is much better, and you get FREE eggs, waffles, biscuits, and gravy on a real breakfast buffet! Not to mention how small the rooms are, the online pictures are definitely misleading!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but not a good location if you're on vacation”
Reviews.Author: travelver611sg
Reviews.Content: We booked one night using an award night. At the time of reservations, we were guaranteed double beds. At the time of arrival, only a single king bed room was available. There were three of us, so I had to sleep on the sofa bed. The sofa bed was the most uncomfortable sofa bed I have ever slept it, it was probably a very old bed. The room smelled like smoke even though it was a non smoking room. The hotel offers free breakfast in the morning, which consist of fruit, cereal, yogurt, bread, and bagels. If you're in vegas mainly to visit the strip, its a little far. Its about a 10 min drive from the strip. For the listed price on their website, I'm sure you can find a cheaper/better deal on one of the hotels on the strip. Other than that, the staff was very apologetic with the sofa bed. I received a email from Hyatt a week later apologizing and that they'll make changes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: TakafumiI
Reviews.Content: Only $30 per person! (With 3 persons in a room) It was very comfortable and clean! We enjoyed swimming too. But a little bit far from Las Vegas Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: fatoldlady
Reviews.Content: ... none of the clang-clang of slot machines in the lobby as in most places here; only the planes passing overhead... but, the hotel well-built and they really don't bother. This "Place" is Hyatt's fewer frills line but, the breakfasts are 'serve-yourself' and free, pool, free wi-fi, snack bar in lobby are really all the amenities you need. The rooms are suites and upper-end furnished. A nice place in what can often be shabby accomodation in this town.

Reviews.Title: “OK but room smelled like smoke and mildew”
Reviews.Author: Rzknow
Reviews.Content: I typically stay at Hyatt Place because I like the predictability of the rooms. This one the room seemed clean but it smelled of mildew and smoke (especially when I first walked in the room). I was only there one night so decided to stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTravel_Queen
Reviews.Content: We are avid Hyatt fans and love the layout of each Hyatt Place. We know in advance that we are going to get a great night's sleep in a signature Hyatt bed. This location was no different. I had hoped that by getting a hotel far way from the strip that we would not be subject to obnoxiously loud and inconsiderate guests returning at late hours of the night. Unfortunately, this was not the case. This is certainly no reflection on the hotel itself, but beware for those of you booking for the reasons we did. The hotel has the standard layout, nice lobby, ample parking, etc. What sets this one apart was the staff. Deanna at the front desk (bless her heart she was there when we checked in at 8 pm and also when we checked out the following morning). She was a doll. Very helpful with show suggestions, directions, etc. The hotel manager I presume was also very helpful and actually assisted in clearing tables in the breakfast area. Certainly not his job, but he didn't seem to mind one bit. That is very uncommon in other parts of the country. There was a hot breakfast included in our rate (omelet was excellent) and we also ordered a waffle which was a bit crunchier than we liked, but no biggie. The cook really tried. Overall, his was a good stay. I just wished we could have been in a quieter part of the hotel. Our preference is always a high floor, in a quiet room, away from the elevators. Sometimes it works out, this time it didn't. A good stay nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a dump”
Reviews.Author: davidcmorris
Reviews.Content: Ordinary at best, really tacky. Much better choices at every level. Not worth it. Awful location except only $15 from airport. Free shuttle ends at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room layout”
Reviews.Author: nighteyesnoire
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hyatt Place often to visit family in Vegas. It's not on the Strip, but that's what we like about it. It's away from traffic congestion & easy to drive in & out of. With no traffic, it's a few-minute drive from the Strip. It's a remodel of an older hotel, but has a more modern look. What I like best is the layout of the single room. Instead of having the bed, TV, chairs & desk all in 1 room, the 1 rectangular room is divided. There is the "living room" side with a large, comfy sofa & large ottoman-coffee table, desk & bar w/ fridge (which is a real fridge, not just a "cooler"). Then there is the sleeping area with the bed, vanity & bathroom. The large flat screen TV divides the room, and you can swivel it, so people can watch on the living room side without lighting up the whole sleeping area. You can also sit & work at the desk area without disturbing the sleeper. (Free wireless Internet, yay!) Rooms have always been clean. Beds & pillows are super-comfy! Staff is very friendly & helpful. Breakfast is included in price (cereal, bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt, juices, good Seattle's Best coffee, no meats), or you can order items from menu. There is also a snack counter in lobby where you can also order beverages, snacks, sandwiches, salads 24/7. The negatives: Bathroom & closet are tiny. Some of the bathroom fixtures (shower nozzle & handles) seem a little unsteady or not installed well. Next door to Hyatt Place is a German beer hall, Hofbrau Haus. Food is excellent ... but it can get loud, esp on weekend nights. Ask for a room away from the restaurant. I read reviews that said parking lot was not safe. So far, it's been fine for us, no break-ins. There is also valet parking. Haven't used the pool or small gym yet ... but both look inviting! Hyatt Place is not fancy or opulent, but it is comfortable & convenient ... more than sufficient for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Starsailing11
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay and good for the budget. near plenty of shops and amenities, and all you could ask for in Vegas. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: AScottCarlson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here six times over the years. We even stayed here a few years ago, on our wedding night. Our Pug Peppar was my best man in our wedding. We take Peppar on all our vacations. We have stayed at the Westin the last few trips, to Vegas and Dallas, they have a Heavenly beds for dogs. The Westin is much nicer, but they were booked so we went with old faithful. On the reservation I put down in the comments "Pug under 25lbs" like I always do. And the cell number if it was needed. After playing poker all night we get back to the room around midnight and our key will not work. We go to the office and are told we need to immediately leave the hotel. The manager explained they have changed their policy and are no longer pet friendly. And when he entered the room to confirm there was a dog, the dog was on the bed. they waited for us to get our belongings and Peppar. I demanded a full refund and was told that would be unlikely as the dog was on the bed. No phone call, no I'm sorry we do not allow dogs anymore during check in. So at 1am after drinking and playing poker all night, as we had walked to the Hard Rock and did not intend to be driving, we were driving around looking for a new hotel. The good: They have redone the rooms and lobby. It is much nicer now. Except the tub and toilette were old. Everything else was very nice. We were very happy at the beginning of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Outside the Strip, calm and convenient close to airport”
Reviews.Author: pmourillon
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Place Las Vegas is close to the airport. Welcome starts with a free Shuttle Bus available upon upon arrival at the airport (though, make sure you book with the concierge in advance). The Shuttle service is also available on your return from the Hotel back to the airport. Very good service from the personel. They will be able to suggest the best attractions and places to visit during your stay. The rooms are specious, clean with free Wi-Fi Internet access (that is a major plus) Close to the airport, outside the Strip, quiet and calm location. 5-10 minutes taxi ride to the heart of Las Vegas where you will be able to enjoy yourself (shows, concerts, bars, clubs, restaurants, casinos of course...!). If you fancy woalking and if it is not too hot or windy you can set off on foot arrive within 25-30 minutes in town. Maybe not the best choice for food (as I do not remember they offered a full restaurant service) Would definietly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CSRE
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you have a car and want to be off the strip. We stayed 4 nights and I never heard a plain (we were on floor 2 facing the parking). Service was great, they had a very yummy free breakfast, also free wii fii and parking, and the same type of room and amenities of every Hyatt place (42 flat TV, 24 hour room service with menu and ordering option on TV, nice bathroom with tub, coffee machine, fridge, big bed, sofa, working desk, nice bedding….) I love the idea of the Hyatt place, it is a basic hotel with everything you need to feel comfortable during your stay. I just love the big flat TV Wherever I go and there is a Hyatt place, I stay there. The price is great for what you get, in our opinion

Reviews.Title: “Great airport/UNLV hotel but in a somewhat sketchy area”
Reviews.Author: everyshadeofblue
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a Hyatt Place property and I really like what they've done with these "older" hotels. The decor is so modern and classy. I like the furniture, color choices, and overall "hipness" of these properties. Room was very clean and has everything you could want: refrigerator, huge plasma TV, free internet, separate bar area, couch, comfortable bed, and nice sink area. The bathroom area itself is a bit tight but not too bad. If you are a "large" person I could imagine you might struggle but it's fine for most. There is a free breakfast which is perfectly fine but it's not a hot breakfast that you'd get at a place like Staybridge Suites. Decent selection of breads, cereal, yogurt, and fruit. Check in was quick, easy, and friendly. All staff I encountered were very nice. The only thing I don't like about this hotel is the location. It's in a somewhat shady area across from UNLV and there are signs all over the parking lot warning you that they are not responsible for items left in cars. I rented a car (they do have a free airport shuttle though) and was scared the whole time I'd find it broken into when I got out. Those signs don't set a good tone but I understand why they are there. Luckily I didn't have any problems and had a great stay. Would stay here again if I wasn't visiting the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: we_6_Kings
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight layover and chose to stay in this Hyatt brand hotel. We frequent Hyatt hotels and this is a very smart, modern and clean hotel. It is a recent acquistion for Hyatt and newly remodeled, alhough I would have sworn it was a brand new hotel! The room had a very comfortable king bed and a separate living room with a couch and table with a desk and kitchen area (sink, micro, frig). The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a free airport shuttle and a free breakfast, although my flight left too early for me to take advantage of it. The breakfast area is large enough, well organized and clean. The hotel is close to the Hard Rock Cafe although traffic is rather busy in this area and the typical seedy Vegas billboards/advertisements surround the area. I felt relatively safe walking across the street to the restaurant. I will definately stay here again should the need arise!

Reviews.Title: “If you value sleep, stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Travels-From-SF
Reviews.Content: 1. The hotel is right under the flight plan of planes taking off from Las Vegas Airport and is very loud. 2. The hotel staff at check-in gave me my room card and did not explain the amenities of the hotel. (I've stayed at Hyatt Place before, so it wasn't a big deal for me. But it is unprofessional.) 3. Checkout took 25 minutes in line. And I was the 1st person in line. Totally unacceptable for there to be one person at checkout desk at 9AM. Granted, the woman being helped when I got the to desk had problems, but it could have been handled a lot better. (like to call a co-worker to help, asking the woman to wait while simple check-outs can occur...) 4. The room had an iron, but no ironing board. Needless to say, I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, safety comes first!”
Reviews.Author: ronenwai
Reviews.Content: Bad, unsafe area of Las Vegas. My car was broken into in the hotel parking, the GPS was stolen. Hotel was extremely experienced and cleaned the broken window glass quickly to hide the shame from the guests. Security cameras are installed everywhere inside the hotel but none outside. If you worry about safety - stay away. I had to waste a day of my trip and paying $200 to fix the window. The manager was apathetic - "there is nothing we can do.." "we are not responsible..." Stay away, safety comes first!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised Me! They Renovated The Amerisuites.”
Reviews.Author: ozbu
Reviews.Content: I use to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel all the time. But sometimes when I couldn't get a room I would stay across the street at the Amerisuites. Mediocre at best and overpriced. BUT NOW! I booked through the Hyatt web site and they surprised me by booking me at the SAME PROPERTY UNDER A NEW NAME. It was WAY WAY WAY BETTER! Everything. Rooms, lobby. Wood paneled and huge flat screen TV. Great Hyatt beds. I read some other reviews about airplane noise. Totally wasn't an issue. Yes they are near McCarron but it's muffled. And I was on the 5th floor. I know my comments sound so good I must be a shill. I'm not. But I am very picky and was expecting another mediocre experience in Vegas hotel staying. I thought this place was perfect. Great service. There was a slow drain in my sink and the TV didn't get HD so they came up immediately and fixed it. There's free internet. Coffee in the room which I like. Huge fluffy pillows which I like. Kind of a suite layout. Living area and bedroom area. Wish I could rag on something here. But can't. I'd look here first before going to any of those crappy casino/spa joints.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Handy Little Place”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend for one night on a Saturday and was familiar with the location as I frequent the Hard Rock Hotel and have also passed by the Hyatt Place on my way to the Vegas airport. Like almost all things in L.V., this is a much larger Hyatt Place than normal and it was pretty full from sports groups booked there (I think the S.D. State women's basketball team was one of the groups there). Seeing that, I was a bit nervous about room noise and the long lines for the complimentary breakfast but after requesting a quiet room, was surprised that it was a nice quiet corner room on the second floor. No noises from the other rooms around or above and the room was clean, well kept and comfortable (if you don't like firm beds then beware). As stated in some of the other posts, the only noise was from the airplanes overhead----having previously lived under a flight path, I think I was somewhat insulated from the noise but it is an issue to consider until they change the flight path. The wait for the breakfast line was not too bad and while they had run out of a couple of things when I first got there, I was surprised at how quickly it was replenished (compared to some of the other Hyatt Places I've stayed at). Did not take advantage of the pool (which was outdoors and looked nice) or the exercise room (which was on the second floor). They have 2 internet stations by the breakfast area in addition to the free wi-fi throughout the hotel. Did not take advantage of the free airport shuttle as I had driven over (but this is a great feature for L.V.) nor the complimentary shuttle to Planet Hollywood as I was told you had to call for pickup. However, location across from the Hard Rock Hotel/Cafe is great and if you're a walker, a great selection of restaurants on their "Restaurant Row" on Flamingo Rd. is about 10 min walk away. Overall, I was impressed with this hotel as I'm a frequent visitor to Vegas and I don't always stay or play on the Strip. If you're looking for Strip casinos or action or this is your first visit to L.V. you might want to pay extra for a strip casino. Otherwise, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Choice for CES Attendees”
Reviews.Author: njm0058
Reviews.Content: As a travel arranger for our company I made this reservation directly on short notice due to all other hotels filled. My traveler attended a convention and this hotel was on the shuttle route. However, the staff was unaware of the timing or any information relative to the shuttle to get to/from the convention and kept referring to going to pick up the shuttle at another nearby hotel. Rooms a bit worn/dirty, and staff were just ok. Not a good choice for people expecting shuttle service for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dbmagic
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt Place is nicely set up... location is actually pretty good. It's directly across corners from the Hard Rock Resort. We did the walk from the Hyatt Place to the strip, and it really wasn't all that bad. It's not all that close, but I work in downtown Chicago and have to walk from my train to my job daily, so it's just another walk. It was close enough that we decided to walk back as well. Our only big gripe with this Hyatt Place is that it seems located directly below the McCarran flight path. It can be somewhat noisy at times. This is sort of a beware type thing, and not something I'd take out on the hotel management. The rooms were spacious and as other Hyatt Places we've stayed at, has a wonderful TV with plenty of HD content available.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Its in the Flight path”
Reviews.Author: PaulLins
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Hyatt as we speak. We came to Vegas for the New Year and chose the hotel after reading the reviews, but mainly because it was opposite the Hard Rock Hotel where we were spending New Years Eve. For the money you can't really complain. The staff are fantastic. When we checked in we were told to use the free shuttle bus that they provide to travel to and from the strip ( it operates from 5.45am and finishes with the last pick up at 11.45pm ) They advised about walking anywhere because of the "area" so be warned!! Our room, like the other reviews suggest, was the size of a suite. Reasonably clean but quite an unpleasant smell lingering in the corridors. We were absolutely gobsmacked to find that we were under the flight path - perhaps flight path are the wrong words. Flight path suggests the planes have actually taken off before they bounce over the roof of the hotel. We are on the top ( 6th ) floor. The planes are constant - the sound of one, not disappearing before the next. The room vibrates as they go over and car alarms in the parking lot below sing in unison as the jets set them off. We asked if we could be moved to a lower floor thinking that maybe a few storeys above us would kill the noise ,but the room we were shown stunk of cigarettes ( although this is a non-smoking hotel ) and there was no getting away from the planes. The local pharmacy sells ear plugs. What we couldn't understand is why no-one else had mentioned this in their reviews. Well the answer is that for the next 6 months they are relaying a section of runway at the airport and during this time planes are taking off and landing on a different approach. So be warned!!!!!!!!! The comp breakfast is not bad, so if it wasn't for the planes the hotel would be fine for a base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ajnoone
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean , comfortable hotel about 1 mile off the strip. It is near the airport and across the street from the Hard Rock Cafe. The rooms are great, like junior suites, with a great buffet breakfast. The pool id quite good. Overall I would recommend a stay there away from the craziness of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for families. Don't expect much.”
Reviews.Author: anonymousLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Hyatt was good w/ our kid. We had to share a room, which is always a bum. Kid on sofabed in living room part. We were cumfy. Bed was foamy. Breakfast was toast, fruit, coffee (no eggs/meat) which left much to be desired. Not enough people working to refill coffee pots, etc. Long lines for breakfast. Even so, for price paid ($120) it was clean and nice and I'd recommend for families. It's a re-don AmeriSuites. Best part was huge flat screen TV. Off strip, and quiet, except for airplanes (right near the airport). Front desk printed out a list of places to take children, which was very nice, and the free shuttle took us to the strip (GREAT!) but didn't know info. for the Strip bus ($5 all day is good for 24-hrs.). Drop off was at Planet Hollywood which was fine and close to everything (Paris/ and Bellagio).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rogercArkansas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Nov 5th - 10th, 2008 while we were in Las Vegas for the PBR World Finals. We chose this hotel because it is close to the Thomas and Mack Center and we could walk to the event each night. The staff was amazing. Everytime we entered the hotel they welcomed us back and asked if we needed anything. Even the shuttle driver asked us if our room was ok and if we needed anything. The free breakfast was adequate. We took advantage of their free shuttle to the strip which leaves every hour during the day until 11:45pm. The rooms are comfortable and clean. When we were ready to leave for our trip home, the shuttle took us back to the airport at no charge. We travel often for both business and pleasure and stay in alot of 5 star hotels. We were so impressed with the staff at the Hyatt Place compared to other hotels. We will definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean, comfortable room at an affordable price just minutes from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A normal business/leisure hotel in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: HowardA
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay at Hyatt Place. I found it pleasant because of several things it didn't have: no resort fee, no electricity fee, no internet usage fee and no outrageous mini-bar fees. These fees are pretty standard at most, if not all the Vegas casino resorts. After a few days, they can really add up. The estimate given to me from their site was exactly the rate I paid to the penny! Also, Hyatt Place opened in December 2007 so it isn't beat up like most of the other places I've stayed in Vegas. I doubt you can find a more comfortable bed in town! Despite not having a restaurant, the amenities at Hyatt Place surpass most of the resorts too. The standard rooms are very large. The 42" HDTV actually gets a ton of HDTV stations and pay per view movies. I'm amazed how many other hotels invest in HDTVs and then don't subscribe to get the HD stations. Of course, in Vegas, most resorts have poor TVs so you spend more time in the casino. The free wireless Internet was fast and flawless. You can connect your ipod to the TV speakers. Just remember to bring a cord. While some people here didn't like the location, I did. The strip mall across the street with the CVS has at least a half dozen good restaurants including a great New York Pizza place. The primary reason I stayed here was it was across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel where I ususally stay. It was sold out during this trip and Hyatt Place was a much less expensive option anyways. You can use the pool at HRH as long as you tell the security guy that you intend on playing at the gambling tables by the pool. This included the Sunday Rehab which is normally an expensive ticket. What incredible eye candy! The Hard Rock Hotel (skip the Hard Rock Cafe) is my absolute favorite place in Las Vegas and where I end my nights when I'm there. Having a nice place to walk to instead of waiting in the huge cab line was great!

Reviews.Title: “A Vegas gem!”
Reviews.Author: wastewar
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. Exceptionally friendly and attentive staff, lovely rooms, great shuttle service to town and the airport as well as a generous morning breakfast and evening nibblies. Our rooms were spacious, beautifully appointed and equipped with Wifi, a wet bar and a gorgeous flatscreen. No casino noise and a perfect oasis of calm. I look forward to retruning next year. Great work Hyatt!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Las Vegas
HotelInfo.Address: 4520 Paradise Road, Las Vegas, NV 89169
